column2: The Financial Analyst will play a key role in facilitating the management of the financial processes, analysis support of a large key account in our business. This position is responsible for forecasting, budgeting, cost management, analysis and ad hoc reporting. In addition, the individual will form relationships with the account team and structure conversations for smart business decisions, enhance reporting capabilities, encourage open communication among the team and establish a framework for accountability.      This position is ideal for someone intellectually curious, highly detail-oriented, entrepreneurial, resourceful, and proactive. The right candidate will exhibit outstanding judgment, professionalism, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, and sometimes ambiguous, work environment. He/she will need to comfortably interact and communicate with individuals at all levels, including senior executives. In addition, this individual will foster and maintain the necessary internal relationships throughout Applause.     Below is an overview of the expectations that are intended to show the basic levels of support required in this role. Ad Hoc analysis and reporting are inevitable components of the FPA function in addition to the specific items noted below.        Core Responsibilities         Working closely with the account team to forecast revenue, expense and capex         Become the account financial advisor; assist with margin improvement plans, assist with financial modeling and analysis on an ad hoc basis and own all reported financial metrics.         Become the accounts go-to person for all things finance related.         Contribute to the annual planning process, primary owner for financial output         Support ongoing reviews of business operations and process improvement initiatives         Assist in monthly accounting close, including detailed expense review/validation for your key account         Month End Close, Reporting and Analysis for FPA and account team         Leverage Adaptive Planning system for forecasting and reporting         Drive automation through existing systems for management reporting wherever possible         Work with managers across the organization to ensure internal/operational financial views are accurate and relevant (Revenue, Margins, OPEX, headcount)         Other ad hoc reporting for FPA, account leadership or executives.          Required Skills         6+ years experience in FPA or corporate finance role         Capable of working in a dynamic, fast-changing, and sometimes ambiguous environment         Demonstrated understanding of finance / accounting principles and concepts         Comfortable learning and managing new financial systems         Great communication skills that will allow you to interact and work with others that do not have a direct-line reporting responsibility to you         Must be extremely well-organized with the ability to multi-task across multiple deliverables, bias towards productivity         Ability to develop detailed financial models, and to synthesize anecdotal and structured information into meaningful insight         Effective presentation skills and experience working with executive leadership with at least 2-5 years of experience in financial management         Prior experience of corporate planning and/or account operations function and proficiency using NetSuite, Adaptive, Xactly, or comparable software tools for financial planning.         Prior experience effectively modeling and presenting data using Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
column11: OPEX, Automation, Excel, Process improvement, Financial planning, Corporate finance, Financial Analyst, Budgeting, Operations, Business operations

column2: We are looking for a Financial Analyst to review, analyze and report the financial progress, and deliver meaningful advice and recommendations based on findings to drive financial performance of the organizational unit        The role will also require to develop financial reporting packages, innovate and drive reporting and analytics solutions      The Financial Analyst will also coordinate and drive the financial planning process of the organization, including forecast, in short to medium term in accordance with global standards                The ideal candidate will have a strong data analytical skill, analyst mentality, and a passion for automating financial reports for cross-functional teams to help them get reports and analysis which can identify trends, patterns, and opportunities, helping to drive efficiency and informed                                      What you will do:                                Financial Planning and Analysis:                          Collect and analyze large datasets from various sources to extract relevant information and provide valuable insights.                      Apply statistical methods to interpret data, identify trends, and develop actionable recommendations.                        Review, analyze and report the Financial Progress            and s    ecure business performance during period-end closing                        Assess performance for financial accounts and targets (primarily P&L, Opex,etc.), comparing Actual results vs. Targets and forecasts or latest estimations                      Calculate hourly rate on unit/legal entity/job stage level, for productive cost centers, according to applicable directives. Activity includes registering output in requested tools.                      Analyze and control costs for assigned unit, Actuals performance vs forecast. Analysis includes: over/under absorption for the time reporting units, cost charging follow-up, headcount review, billability, trends, run rates, deviations, etc.                      Provide insightful variance analysis to highlight key business drivers and recommend strategic actions to achieve financial objectives.                      Monitor and analyze key performance indicators, highlighting trends and analyzing causes of unexpected variances.                              Automation/ Digitalization, Dashboarding & Data Visualization:                          Automate, design and create interactive dashboards and reports for stakeholders using tools like Power BI, or other relevant software, communicating data-driven insights in a visually compelling manner for efficient analysis and actions.                      Collaborate with teams to understand reporting requirements and deliver solutions that meet business needs to automate.                      Tools & Resources knowledge: Advances Excel skills, Power point, VBA coding, Power Bi, SQL, SAP Analytical Cloud (SAC), Business Warehouse (P50), BPC, Business Objects, MicroStrategy Tool, SAP (P12)                              You will bring:                            Education: A degree in Business Administration, Chartered Accountant, CFA or equivalent qualification with knowledge and interest in automation. Degree/ knowledge in Data Science is a big plus.                              5-10 years experience from relevant position within Ericsson or relevant position at an external company giving the ability to act and perform the duties of the role Financial Analyst                          Experience with coding and data visualization tools such as Power BI, or similar.                          Effective communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings to stakeholders

column2: You will be part of the Finance Centre of Excellence capability in Technology Finance.      As a Business Partner supporting the Chief Data and Analytics Office (CDAO), you will be contributing to the business priorities by providing insight and supporting stakeholders with financial outcomes related to expense management and commercials of Technology.        Your primary roles is to:        Support the Chief Data and Analytics Office (CDAO) and where required for Run BAU expenses      Provide insights, analysis and advice in relation to past and future financial performance      Provide robust financial control and effective management reporting        Provide decision support and reporting for Technology strategic initiatives and investment programs.          Develop and deliver meaningful insights to    drive better business outcomes and provide commercial support, including cost optimisation and simplification.      Provide guidance and advice to the business leaders on the financial performance of the business, the financial plans and forecasts and the financial impacts of change initiatives.              Roles & Responsibilities:            This role is responsible for regular deliverables including actuals, budget and forecast reporting for opex and investment programmes/projects      Financial Control responsibilities including journal preparation, account reconciliations, balance sheet reviews and FTE reporting      Responsible for assisting in the delivery of the annual budgeting and monthly/quarterly forecast processes.      The role has strong stakeholder relationships within Technology, BU Finance and the CDAO extended leadership team.      Reporting and analytics to facilitate decision making.      Review, analyse and constructively challenge the monthly project & BAU spend with a view to understanding the status of each project, including milestones, risks, issues, financial status (actuals, forecasts, budgets), and progress made each month.      Build and maintain relationships and trust with the project community and application management team to facilitate access to information and provide a contact point back for value added advice to the assigned programme/project teams.      Engage in continuous improvement activities to streamline, simplify, automate and assist in the implementation of new reporting tools.            Essential Skills:          Qualified CA / CPA/ MBA Finance      5+ years experience in finance and accounting industry      Strong analytical skills with proven experience in budgeting and forecasting      Strong stakeholder management, communication skills and demonstrated experience of business partnering.      Experience in a Finance Centre of Excellence team with strong track record in driving automation and implementation of reporting tools      Strong understanding of Technology Business Management, gained in either a similar role and/or an IT Finance or IT Business Manager role.        Risk      Mindset - All CommBank employees are expected to proactively identify and understand, openly discuss and act on current and future risks.              Qualifications:          Qualified CA / CPA/ MBA Finance with 5+ years experience in finance and accounting industry

column2: Skill required:Finance Processes and Operations - Finance Strategy  Designation:Management Level - Senior Analyst  Qualifications:BCom/Master of Business Administration/CA Inter  Years of Experience:5 to 8 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions. The team aligns Finance with Business Strategy in order to maximize operational efficiency and effectiveness by harnessing the power of robotics to accelerate transaction processing, with AI to provide analysis and commentary and machine learning deployed for matching and reconciliations This team is responsible for leading the transformation agenda for our clients by helping them improve finance function performance within the context of their organizations' strategies. The team leads growth and mining in existing F&A accounts for industry segments. This team works across Procure to Pay (PTP), Record to Report (RTR), Order to cash (OTC), Finance Processes (FPNA), Tax and Treasury towers to provide best in the class industry view, support existing engagements, diagnostic, due diligence, client co-design workshops, transformation engagement, drive existing client portfolios. The team works on Industry Digital F&A technologies&leading tools, automation, AI, and Analytics.  What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible  Ability to perform under pressure  Ability to establish strong client relationship  Ability to work well in a team  Strong analytical skills Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of increasingly complex problems  Your day to day interactions are with peers within Accenture  You are likely to have some interaction with clients and/or Accenture management  You will be given minimal instruction on daily work/tasks and a moderate level of instruction on new assignments  Decisions that are made by you impact your own work and may impact the work of others  In this role you would be an individual contributor and/or oversee a small work effort and/or team  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

Work extensively with cross-functional teams across different geographies. column2: As financial analyst of G&A function, you shall prepare segment P&L for management reporting, prepare Annual plan and monitor variance by working with budget owners, co-ordinate with accounting for monthly closing process including accruals, reconciliations.                   ?             Reporting to :       Director, Finance                       ?           Academic Credentials :    B.com With CA / ICWA / CFA / MBA Finance / CA / CWA Inter, M.com, with other related professional qualifications.                          ?             Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:                     Consolidation of World Wide P&L for planning, actuals and forecast purposes including cost allocation                     Support monthly close process understanding accounting entries and accrual estimates               Revenue -               Reporting at a consolidated level with the various constituents/details like vertical, sales, and delivery region, and type of revenue like new, existing, GTE, customer, LOBs, etc.                     Analyse revenue and revenue-related items to be able to explain the variance between plan, actuals, and forecast.                      Understand the detailed products and offerings of the Company and the flow of information from the sales cycle in salesforce (CRM tool) to actual reporting in NetSuite ERP               Cost -               Review of costs pertaining to operations and support functions and guide them as required on the accuracy and timing of the forecasts and plan and provide qualitative commentary on material variances                     Discussion with various stakeholders like accounting, operations finance & other finance teams on a day-to-day basis to ensure alignment in numbers and strategies                     Managing logics of indirect cost allocations basis cost drivers and formulas for segment financial reporting                     Facilitating and implementing cost control measures and coordinating with budget controllers to track                   Capex - Tracking actual Capex and control over the forecast             ERP             Supporting ERP system or process implementation and upkeep.                  Data integrity of financial reporting tools with ERP (Net suite to NSPB or such tools) and make recommendations to streamline systems and processes, simplifying logic and formulas of the reporting tools. Drive automation and improvement of the existing database.             Reporting packages             Presentation to ESM, Board, and management with details of profitability and direction of the business                 Monthly reporting pack under-reporting tool including Dashboard and Key metrics.                   Prepare and track monthly calendar of deliverables across the finance function.                         Competitor benchmarking analysis and KPIs, like SaaS/business metrics related to revenue, customer, and industry verticals.                      Required Skills                     ?         This role requires a strong understanding of financial reporting, and accounting, good business acumen, and the ability to effectively communicate the recommendations that result from rigorous quantitative and financial analyses.                  ?           Other requirements include the following:                   4 - 8 years experience in highly quantitative financial roles with a demonstrated growth progression                      Previous work experience in External reporting and/or Financial Planning and Analysis roles within the IT Services/Software industry is an advantage                          Strong understanding of finance concepts and accounting principles                           Self-starter with the ability to successfully build strong partner relationships as a trusted advisor at multiple levels.                       Impeccable communication skills (verbal & written) is a must                     Excellent time management, organizational, and follow-up skills and ability to multitask.                     Attention to detail and strong follow-through                      Advanced/expert technical skills in some or all the following: Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and financial and statistical modeling                     Tech Savviness and experience in working or interfacing with ERP and SaaS tools will be an added advantage.                         Well versed with experience in financial planning & analysis, Budgeting & Forecasting, Expense Reporting, Headcount reporting, MIS reporting, Executive management reporting (EMR), Variance analysis and Client Engagement.                             Flexibility and be able to work with a diverse team across multiple geographies and time zones.

column1: Financial Plan & Analysis Analyst-Finance Processes and Operations
column2: Skill required:Finance Processes and Operations - Finance Strategy  Designation:Management Level - Analyst  Job Location:Hyderabad  Qualifications:BCom/Master of Business Administration/CA Inter  Years of Experience:3 to 5 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions. The team aligns Finance with Business Strategy in order to maximize operational efficiency and effectiveness by harnessing the power of robotics to accelerate transaction processing, with AI to provide analysis and commentary and machine learning deployed for matching and reconciliations This team is responsible for leading the transformation agenda for our clients by helping them improve finance function performance within the context of their organizations' strategies. The team leads growth and mining in existing F&A accounts for industry segments. This team works across Procure to Pay (PTP), Record to Report (RTR), Order to cash (OTC), Finance Processes (FPNA), Tax and Treasury towers to provide best in the class industry view, support existing engagements, diagnostic, due diligence, client co-design workshops, transformation engagement, drive existing client portfolios. The team works on Industry Digital F&A technologies&leading tools, automation, AI, and Analytics.  What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible  Ability to perform under pressure  Ability to establish strong client relationship  Ability to work well in a team  Strong analytical skills Roles and Responsibilities  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems  Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors  In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management  You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments  The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column2: The Financial Modeling Group provides expert services for our most sophisticated analytical tools so that we can provide customers with a tailored experience when using our products     This global, seasoned team specializes in onboarding and customer adoption for our Excel add-ins, Office Tools products, Screening and Platform Customization, and Proprietary Data capabilities     Comprised of former investment professionals, CFA charterholders, and MBAs, Financial Modeling is charged with understanding our customers needs and objectives and providing solutions to enhance their workflows     As a member of the Financial Modeling Group, you will become proficient in at least two of the below specialties     As corporate finance and Excel modeling experts, Application Associates spend their time consulting with customers about our Excel add-in solutions (CIQ/ CIQ Pro) and how best to implement their data in their models, which run the gamut of valuation, ownership, estimates, charts, etc Application Associates also create and convert financial models from competing platforms for our customers     Additionally, the Application Associates build and maintain ~500 pre-built templates made available via the combined CIQ and CIQ Pro Excel add-in Template Library                 The Impact:        The Financial Modeling Group is one of the primary touchpoints for our customers, and you will be the face of the organization     Your regular day would require you to build models, screens, presentations, answer customer queries and be an advocate of our products while showcasing your vast knowledge of our tools and data     In addition to working with our customers, you will also work with our Commercial team on winning and maintaining business, our Product team on future enhancements, and our Customer Services team on training and customer queries                 What's in it for you:         Explore a highly rewarding career path with room for professional growth, recognition and rewards.     You can be part of a company that is a results-focused meritocracy. We set high standards and value accountability. We seek to identify and reward extraordinary performance with growth opportunities.     Master the knowledge of SP Capital IQ SP Capital IQ Pro products and services.     Gain exposure to other departments by liaising with Relationship Management, Product Management and Customer Services teams.     Opportunity to work with highly professional and business-driven team members.     Work with diverse teams and customers spread across the globe.             Responsibilities:          Ability to understand client-specific requirements across all covered data sets and products.     Work with clients across multiple geographies including USA, EMEA and APAC and address their requirements.     Create quantitative models, screens, and presentations, among others, for our customers using our suite of products.     Support our customer base in their research by responding to requests that come through calls, e-mails, and meetings.     Partner with product teams on timely and thorough testing of our products, with an eye towards exceptional customer experience.     Consistently make proactive suggestions around product usability, presentation, and data quality.     Work with product experts on projects which improve and develop subject matter expertise.     Drive Team initiatives and knowledge sharing activities to support the culture of learning and development.     Create new opportunities for Automation and LEAN to improve the workflow efficiency.         Basic Qualifications:         Masters Degree in Finance or Business.     Strong understanding and knowledge of the fundamentals of business, financial statements, and investments. Proficient in research and analysis.     Good knowledge and understanding of capital and commodity markets.     Inclination towards the customer-oriented approach.     Succinct communication skills. Strong collaboration skills.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.     Ability to multitask and prioritize workflow with little supervision.     Advanced Excel and Powerpoint knowledge.     Willingness to work in rotational shifts.             Preferred Qualifications:         VBA Knowledge is a plus.           Benefits:             Health Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.         Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.         Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.         Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.         Family Friendly Perks: It s not just about you. SP Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.         Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards small perks can make a big difference

Good working knowledge on month end closing process for any Legal entity, financial instruments reporting and disclosure as per US GAAP / IFRS.                     Understanding of cross border transactions between Nomura subsidiaries and ensuring all the Inter Company transactions are reconciled, breaks resolved and gets eliminated upon consolidation. column2: As a Technical Operations Analyst you will support some of Stripe s most critical payment flows and a platform that processes hundreds of billions of dollars in payments a year.      Our team builds and scales the infrastructure and financial partner integrations that enables Stripe to accept, manage, and payout money across many countries, currencies, and payment methods.      Responsibilities      Process reconciliation requests to ensure money is accurately ledgered        Process support requests from banking partners regarding problematic account transfers, refunds, payments, or fees        Interface with strategic banking partners, providing fast, accurate responses to complex support inquiries        Investigate causes of un-reconciled cash payments across payment methods        Partner with internal and external teams to validate the accuracy of Stripe s financial data        Introduce data and process efficiencies to meet the scale and speed of Stripe.        Interface with Stripe s financial partners across the world to drive alignment between their products and how Stripe uses them, and hold Stripe s partners accountable to resolve day-to-day operational breakages.        Identify and automate inefficient operational processes to reduce manual workloads        Who you are    We re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.    Minimum requirements      Have at least 4 years experience in a technical role, with at least 2+ years of experience in SQL queries.        Have experience navigating the nuanced complexity of financial systems and solving large scale, technical challenges.        Have strong analytical skills to investigate, prioritize, and identify the root cause of issues.        Have experience in communications and workflows with technical and non-technical teams across internal and external stakeholders (including external financial partners and vendors).        Are comfortable operating independently and thrive in a fast-paced environment to deliver results, with an ability to establish priorities and reliably execute against time-sensitive deadlines.        Ability to create and develop reports for business reviews        Have experience identifying and triaging technical issues        Identifying areas of improvement and focus on automation        Preferred qualifications      Experience in financial reporting, payments and reconciliation.        Experience implementing or using programmatic approaches to reconciliation        Familiarity with back-office processes for clearing, settlement, and cash conversion        Knowledge of Accounting, SWIFT, FP&A, would be an advantage but not essential.        Pay and benefits      Stripe does not yet include pay ranges in job postings in every country. Stripe strongly values pay transparency and is working toward pay transparency globally.

column2: Spreetail is seeking a Financial Analyst to join its team        The Financial Analyst will be responsible for billing statements, AR aging report and implementing strategies to mitigate credit risk      We expect successful people to drive the results that impact our larger goals      We will hold you accountable to the work you do and the results you drive           How you will achieve success:        Perform reviews or our weekly and monthly billing statements and provide feedback to Accounting and leadership on gaps and opportunities      Maintain a healthy AR aging report; assist with providing accurate and timely reporting      Develop and implement strategies to mitigate credit risk and improve cash flow      Work to identify opportunities for process improvements and automation with the AR function      Provide insights and recommendations to senior management and executive leadership on AR analysis; perform Ad Hoc reporting as needed                What experiences will help you in this role:        Bachelor s degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field or a minimum of 5 years experience in an accounting or finance role      Previous experience in accounts receivable management or financial analysis role preferred      Proficiency with Excel for data analysis and reporting; strong analytical skills, attention to detail and organizational skills      Experience in process improvement initiatives or automation projects is a plus; ability to drive processes into new technologies      Ability to work in a fun, fast-paced, high-volume work environment; a passion for seeing tasks through completion

column2: You ll lead all aspects of cost planning, from developing budgets to identifying and presenting opportunities to optimize costs. You will be the FP&A partner for all cross-functional teams and be comfortable and effective at communicating finance concepts to colleagues with various professional backgrounds. This role requires a creative problem solver that is highly motivated and curious to know the why behind business trends. If you possess both exceptional technical & interpersonal skills and want to use this unique combination to influence the strategy and success of a high-growth ecommerce marketplace, we encourage you to apply.                 Responsibilities:               Lead multi-geo cost planning and adherence by developing defensible budgets, tracking actual performance, and investigating major variances.             Develop different views of the P&L to provide leadership with actionable business insights and recommendations to drive growth while optimizing costs                 Create/upgrade bottom-up forecasting models for all costs, while improving predictive accuracy and furthering the automation of these models             Collaborate with accounting, data analytics, and business systems teams, as well as stakeholders across the company on all of the above             Serve the Poshmark user community by identifying and pursuing opportunities to make their Poshmark experience even better               6-Month Accomplishments                Demonstrate a perspective on cost planning that balances business investment needs with ROI objectives, and be able to provide recommendations that reflect this thinking             Take cost planning to the next level by automating and improving on current processes to increase cost predictability and improve planning efficiency                   12+ Month Accomplishments               Partner cross-functionally with teams within the organization to solve business problems, and develop a strong relationship with the stakeholders             Demonstrate a command of cost drivers, data sources and planning assumptions             Proactively identify and drive new initiatives/projects to increase operational efficiencies and support rapid growth                   Minimum Skills and Experience:               BS/BA in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or similar,              2+ years in Finance, Banking, and/or Management Consulting             An understanding of corporate financial planning, modeling, reporting and analysis             Basic knowledge of accounting concepts             Highly analytical, detail oriented and creative problem solver             Proven ability to achieve results in a fast-paced, growing and ambiguous environment             Excellent communication (written and verbal) skills and ability to collaborate constructively with, and influence business partners                   Preferred Skills and Experience:               Experience in startup or high-growth company corporate finance              Experience with Pigment, Adaptive or similar planning tools             Experience in or understanding of e-commerce and/or marketplace business models

column2: Skill required:  Record To Report - Financial Consolidation & Close Operations Designation:  Record to Report Ops Analyst Qualifications: BCom/Chartered Accountant/CA Inter  Years of Experience: 3 to 5 years  Language - Ability: English - Advanced  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions.Posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, preparing cash forecasting statement, supporting month end closing, preparing reports and supports in audits.The Financial Consolidation & Close Operations team is responsible for general ledger processes including year-end closing, journalizing, etc. They help create & maintain ledgers, currencies, budgets, & journal entries, deliver solutions including a flexible accounting structure, comprehensive journal processing, hierarchical summaries, intuitive inquiry & reporting, dynamic allocations & the management of commitments & expenditures, run interface reports & perform close books of accounts. The team reviews P&L accounts errors, omissions, or inconsistencies and managing the preparation of all reports. They also work on posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, investigating and reporting open items, reviewing entries and reconciliations, supporting month-end closing, preparing various reports as required, and supporting audits. The team also oversees improvement projects, including automation, simplifications, and enhanced controls. What are we looking for? Journal Entry Processing Financial Consolidation & Close Operations Balance Sheet Account Reconciliations Agility for quick learning Problem-solving skills Strong analytical skills Written and verbal communication SAP FI CO Finance Microsoft Excel  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification BCom,Chartered Accountant,CA Inter

column2: The primary purpose of this role requires management of financial accounting process for Marketing & Promotion team and related activities like budget management, reconciliation and reporting of financials.                      The incumbent will be required to closely work with various stakeholders across Business LFOs/IOs, Marketing and GSM teams. The role will require strong focus on generating efficiencies, accelerating accounting processes and ensuring overall governance.            Academic Background:                        Graduate / Post-Graduate in Commerce or MBA with 1-4 years of relevant experience in financial accounting domain.            Responsibilities:                        Prepare monthly reconciliations. Updating Forecast & Budget as and when requested by market                      Responding to the email queries from stakeholders                      Adherence to the compliance to policies & internal controls                      Monthly booking of accruals                      Supporting the audit & SOX requests            Functional Knowledge:                        Responsible for owning & maintaining financial/data integrity, compliance with internal service level agreements (SLA), guidelines, accounting policies and regulatory requirements as applicable.                      Ability to work across multiple time zones                      The incumbent will be required to have strong accounting & reconciliation knowledge, policy awareness & control mindset with ability to read, interpret various contractual terms/SOWs and apply to function and activities.                      Strong communication, relationship management & collaboration skills while closely working with various stakeholders across Marketing, Controllership, Business Finance, Audit and Control groups.                      High proficiency in MS-Office applications, Oracle Applications (General Ledger + Subledger), Essbase/TM1, etc.            Additional:                        Analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve queries with the ability to deal with                      large set of data.                      Excellent verbal & written communication with good presentation skills.                      Quick learner, an eye for detail and ability to work during ambiguity.                      Should be able to work independently with minimal supervision.            Technical:                        Good understanding of general accounting principles and basic techno finance/automation knowhow will be an added advantage.

column2: The objective of Contract and IT Sourcing Management is to source all relevant IT-Services that are to be provided from the client IT s Strategic ensuring budget adherence and fulfilment of supplier s obligations      In this context the Financial Management Team is acting as a bridging function ensuring transparent and aligned cost management for IT infrastructure run as well as license costs      Due to the respective harmonization initiative aims for a consolidated cost management to ensure e2e process excellence as well as an efficient daily business continuity                 Background to the assignment:                      The external colleague needs to be able to evaluate overarching process dependencies by monitoring the daily business, to capture process gaps and advise the Financial Management Team on process optimization automation and the client does not have that kind of resource internally      Therefore, the external consultant has a unique position compared to the clients internal project staff and provides significantly different services than the internal staff                 Task description:                      Process improvements in consumption and cost planning. This includes the below subtasks:                    Based on own expertise, identification of process improvements for drawing together information coming from the respective service owners and stakeholders, with the aim of defining expected consumption values and the resulting cost. Subsequent implementation of these improvements. Getting approval from client FM Team before implementation.                  Continuous update with actual consumption data of teams internal Data base as a common and centrally governed financial management tool with daily rolling forecasting.                  Advise on identified gaps in the planning, definition of counter measures on how to close existing gaps and how to structurally avoid them for the future.                  Analyze the ongoing process optimization in terms of hardware planning and derive commercials related synchronizations. Based on findings, advise on how these processes can be further standardized and stabilized. Getting approval from the FM Team before implementation.                  Optimize and standardize the invoice planning overview and aligned processes by maintaining a transparent purchase order overview, a tracking file for the status of invoices.                    Analysis for potential further optimization and standardization with regards on existing automated robotics solutions. This includes the below subtasks:                    Define measures on how to further standardize and stabilize existing automated process runs with regards to financial planning and aligned invoicing processes, based on own expertise. Present results to the client FM Team.                  Verify volume and cost related planning activities (esp. forecasting- and mid-term planning) on how these processes can be further standardized and stabilized.                  Consult the FM team on maintaining robotics solutions in handling automated purchase ordering.                  Analyze and advise on further synchronization initiatives, especially with regards to different corporate toolsets, like SAP, MS and further applications with the goal to achieve data consistency and consolidated data base.                    Required skills:                    Strong stakeholder management experience and financial management experience, excellent analytical skills, used to managing in complex environments                  Excellent technical skills in Microsoft office cloud environment and business process management tools (SAP)                  Excellent language skills in English; Nice to have: German.
column11: IT services, Analyst, Process optimization, Automation, SAP, Financial planning, German, Forecasting, Monitoring

column2: We are looking for a Tax Analyst to join our fast-paced, dynamic Managed Returns for Accountants team       This is a great opportunity for a candidate to work in an innovative environment and grow within our business     The Analyst will be responsible for identifying areas of improvement as well as serving accounting firms as their primary point of contact     The candidate must be highly driven, detail oriented and proficient at balancing multiple priorities/issues            Job Duties               Relationship Management and Communication                           This role is specific to the Managed Returns for Accountants offering where you will be providing a high level of service to accounting firms signed up for the returns service       As a tax analyst on the Managed Returns for Accountants team, you are the point of contact for firm interactions     In this role, you should expect to participate in onboarding calls fielding compliance related questions to include transactional imports     You will be responsible for preforming validation checks to verify the setup by the accounting firm     You will dedicate a of your day fielding communication, both internal and external, regarding firm returns service     To succeed, you must be comfortable taking ownership of your firm s overall satisfaction and you must be empathetic to customer needs     Your understanding of the firm s needs will enable them to get the full benefit of Avalara s expertise and software enabling them to self-serve where possible     Compliance is complex, so your ability to set expectations and relay information in an easily understood manner is essential; this includes potential escalations where clear and timely communication is imperative               Job Duties                 Prepare, review, and file multi-jurisdictional sales/use, business and occupation, and gross receipts tax returns for monthly, quarterly, semi-annual, and annual filings.         Manage a select group of accounting firms as their primary point of contact.         Responsible for troubleshooting technical questions from accounting firms regarding the technology and/or client set up.         Ability to research and resolve jurisdictional notices on behalf of the firm s clients.         Responsible for the on-boarding and validation of new sales/use tax returns and reporting back to accounting firms where there is a discrepancy.         Responsible for trouble shooting automation issues while on a call with a firm.          Identifying and improving automation to serve our clients across a variety of market and tax verticals.         Communicate regularly and effectively with firms, jurisdictions, and other internal teams as part of research and resolution.         Perform QA related to the firm s clients set up and report back to the accounting firm with discrepancies.         Perform QA related to sales and use tax content and form changes.         Manage workload to effectively meet deadlines.         Identify ways to improve process and/or technology to better serve our clients.         Work collaboratively with all staff members and management.       What Youll Need to be Successful                     Qualifications                   (I2)         Tax Analyst: Typically requires a Bachelors degree and a minimum of 2 years of related experience.             (I3)         Tax Analyst: Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelors degree; or 3 years and a Masters degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent work experience.         Strong analytical, research, and problem-solving skills.         Excellent written and verbal communication skills         Ability to work independently yet still function as a team player.         Ability to prioritize and multi-task to meet strict filing deadlines.         Ability to learn and adapt to different software applications and tools.         Must have advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Excel (functions include power pivot, VLOOKUP, etc.)                       Preferred Qualifications               Advanced degree in accounting or finance         Experience with a Big 4 firm, large corporate tax department of a multinational company, or large ERP integration.
column11: Relationship management, Tax Analyst, ERP, Automation, Accounting, VLOOKUP, Taxation, Troubleshooting, Corporate taxation, Tax returns

column2: Skill required:  Record To Report - Financial Consolidation & Close Operations Designation:  Record to Report Ops Analyst Qualifications: BCom  Years of Experience: 3 to 5 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions.Posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, preparing cash forecasting statement, supporting month end closing, preparing reports and supports in audits.The Financial Consolidation & Close Operations team is responsible for general ledger processes including year-end closing, journalizing, etc. They help create & maintain ledgers, currencies, budgets, & journal entries, deliver solutions including a flexible accounting structure, comprehensive journal processing, hierarchical summaries, intuitive inquiry & reporting, dynamic allocations & the management of commitments & expenditures, run interface reports & perform close books of accounts. The team reviews P&L accounts errors, omissions, or inconsistencies and managing the preparation of all reports. They also work on posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, investigating and reporting open items, reviewing entries and reconciliations, supporting month-end closing, preparing various reports as required, and supporting audits. The team also oversees improvement projects, including automation, simplifications, and enhanced controls. What are we looking for? Account Reconciliations Fixed Asset Accounting Financial Consolidation & Close Operations Oil & Gas Supply Chain  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification BCom

Contribute to the development and implementation of financial policies and procedures.             Utilize analytical tools and methodologies to extract insights from financial and operational data.                       After the first year:               Maintain momentum against key objectives set-out as part of the first 6 months         Leveraging efficient financial modelling techniques and systems to deliver monthly rolling forecast capabilities for the business         Provide business partnership to Marketing and Product teams through effective financial analysis against investment initiatives and ROI against actual performance of key initiatives         Creating a connected data, insight and analytics capability enabled by a digital core         Achieving end to end process automation and self-service delivery of financial performance for Executive leadership                       What you'll bring:                   Excellent educational background with accounting qualification.2+ years post qualified             Practical experience in technology sector preferably in Software (3 to 5 years experience)             Previous industry experience in a financial reporting role (2 to 3 years experience)             Proficiency in tools like Salesforce,Power BI, Excel, and PowerPoint. Enjoys working in a hands-on environment and has a genuine interest in understanding the issues behind the numbers         Strong intellect and excellent influencing skills. column2: Month end closing :          As part of a diverse multinational accounting team we seek to provide continual improvement in controls and processes. We also roll out automation, while ensuring the highest standards in assurance. We assist with monthly local statutory accounting and other statutory compliance reporting and filing as well as US GAAP accounting.        Accrual preparation and postings:          During month close team review accruals as submitted by business and make sure these are as per accounting policies. Preparations, review and posting of accrual journals are essential part of profile.        Preparation of Balance sheet reconciliations -        This role requires attention details skill set to understand the balance sheet reconciliations and identify the items where rectification is needed and upload same in Blackline.          Accounting of Prepaid expense:          Role needed a good accounting knowledge of Prepaid expenses. It involves recognition of Prepaid expenses as per policy and amortization of same in timely and accurately amortizations.        Bank research and reconciliations:          Person should have and an experience on various reconciliations activities. Bank reconciliation and Bank research are one of essential month close activity.        Fixed asset accounting          Fixed accounting has an activity of assets additions, deletions during the month. Also need to analyze construction in progress assets and settlement of them as per USGAAPs and local GAAPs.        Audit Support:          Drive strong data and process governance and standardization, and support audit requests. Understand audit requirement and Prepare audit schedules for internal as well as external auditors. Resolving audit queries in timely manner.        BS and PL variance (trend) analysis:          As a reporting exercise, person must understand the data integrity and prepare the accrual variance analysis. For management reporting purpose PL variance and trend analysis are essential and person must be well versed with these activities.        SOP preparations and automation opportunities:          Preparation of SOPs for existing processes and finding the opportunity of automation of steps with the help of technology.        Project support:          Team member will be actively working on various Finance project as contributor and lead under this role. Hence cross functional communication is crucial. Co-ordination with cross function teams EMEA , USA , JAPAC :          USGAAP and IGAAP reporting ;        Candidate should have good knowledge of technical accounting standard under USGAAP and IGAAP. This would help team to extend support at global level during close and various

column2: Skill required:  Record To Report - Financial Consolidation & Close Operations Designation:  Record to Report Ops Senior Analyst Qualifications: BCom/Chartered Accountant/CA Inter  Years of Experience: 5 to 8 years  About Accenture Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security.Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services, and Accenture Song all powered by the worlds largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities.Visit us at www.accenture.com  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions.Posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, preparing cash forecasting statement, supporting month end closing, preparing reports and supports in audits.The Financial Consolidation & Close Operations team is responsible for general ledger processes including year-end closing, journalizing, etc. They help create & maintain ledgers, currencies, budgets, & journal entries, deliver solutions including a flexible accounting structure, comprehensive journal processing, hierarchical summaries, intuitive inquiry & reporting, dynamic allocations & the management of commitments & expenditures, run interface reports & perform close books of accounts. The team reviews P&L accounts errors, omissions, or inconsistencies and managing the preparation of all reports. They also work on posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, investigating and reporting open items, reviewing entries and reconciliations, supporting month-end closing, preparing various reports as required, and supporting audits. The team also oversees improvement projects, including automation, simplifications, and enhanced controls. What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible Ability to perform under pressure Problem-solving skills Detail orientation Ability to establish strong client relationship  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of increasingly complex problems Your day to day interactions are with peers within Accenture You are likely to have some interaction with clients and/or Accenture management You will be given minimal instruction on daily work/tasks and a moderate level of instruction on new assignments Decisions that are made by you impact your own work and may impact the work of others In this role you would be an individual contributor and/or oversee a small work effort and/or team Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification BCom,Chartered Accountant,CA Inter

column1: Record To Report Ops Senior Analyst
column2: Skill required:  Record to Report - Financial Consolidation & Close Operations Designation:  Senior Analyst Qualifications: Any Graduation,CA Inter,Chartered Accountant  Years of Experience: 5-8 Years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions. The Record to Report team helps clients and organizations in their operational efficiency and balance sheet integrity, cuts time to close and safeguards compliance with regulatory requirements. The areas where this team's expertise lies is in posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, preparing cash forecasting statement, supporting month end closing, preparing reports and supports in audits. The Financial Consolidation & Close Operations team is responsible for general ledger processes including year-end closing, journalizing, etc. They help create & maintain ledgers, currencies, budgets, & journal entries, deliver solutions including a flexible accounting structure, comprehensive journal processing, hierarchical summaries, intuitive inquiry & reporting, dynamic allocations & the management of commitments & expenditures, run interface reports & perform close books of accounts. The team reviews P&L accounts errors, omissions, or inconsistencies and managing the preparation of all reports. They also work on posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, investigating and reporting open items, reviewing entries and reconciliations, supporting month-end closing, preparing various reports as required, and supporting audits. The team also oversees improvement projects, including automation, simplifications, and enhanced controls. What are we looking for? Accounting & Financial Reporting Standards  Ability to establish strong client relationship  Ability to handle disputes  Ability to perform under pressure  Ability to work well in a team  Agility for quick learning  Accounting and Financial Reporting Standard-Reboot  Regulatory Operations  Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of increasingly complex problems  Your day to day interactions are with peers within Accenture  You are likely to have some interaction with clients and/or Accenture management  You will be given minimal instruction on daily work/tasks and a moderate level of instruction on new assignments  Decisions that are made by you impact your own work and may impact the work of others  In this role you would be an individual contributor and/or oversee a small work effort and/or team  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column1: Senior Lead Financial Analyst ( Night Shift - 6 PM - 3 AM IST)
column2: Department Global Business Finance  India Location Bangalore, India Reporting Structure Functional Administrative Field Finance Manager Finance Span of Control Direct Reportees N/A Indirect Reportees Financial Analysts Role Objective Business Partner and Functional expert providing detailed analysis and decision making support to stakeholders, so as to facilitate future business strategies. Sales knowledge would be added advantage (Sales cycle in SW Co??) Principal Expectation The primary responsibilities of the role are as follows:  Co-Pilots to Business Partners  Own responsibilities / tasks end-to-end; Dedicated / exclusive support for specific business areas.  Liaise with GBF, Business & Business Ops organizations to execute deliverables (Forecast & Budget review)  Provide expertise in defining & implementing Business Org changes (SCOA)  Actively participate in GPO initiatives and projects  Translate vague / adhoc business requirements into productive analysis; Complex Scenario Building (Eg: LRP)  Interpret adhoc requirements from business and define a solution address the objective of such adhoc requirements  Understand key business drivers, define KPIs and incorporate them into packs published to business; Review and update KPIs in sync with changes in business  Drive discussions, consolidate and summarize positions; Substitute effectively for Finance Business Partners' absence;  Initiate, own and drive key initiatives / projects with periodic reviews, provide updates and proactively initiate course corrections Additional responsibilities:  Lead / Drive standardization / automation initiatives  Mentor Analysts; Design training programs  Proactively identify opportunities for efficiency gains and propose solutions to management, share best practices. Key Stakeholders Entity/ Contact Nature/ Interaction ?Internal  GFIC GBF Teams ??cross LoB & divisions  GFIC Management Teams  Delivery related  Operations Reviews Entity/ Contact Nature/ Interaction External  Field Finance  Finance Projects Team  Business / Business Ops Team  Activity planning  Forecast Calls  Project / Status updates Qualifications & Experience Education MBA, CA or CIMA or CMA Experience 9+ years of relevant experience in FP&A Competencies Functional Behavioral Essential  Analytical / BI Tools  Expert MS-Office Skills  Understanding of ERP / CRM  Performance Drive & Execution  Collaboration  Communicating for Impact  Inspirational Leadership  Competitive Edge  Change Agility  Mastering Complexity Desired  Project Management  Certification on Lean principles ??????? Performance Drive and Execution  ??which is all about leading by example to deliver business results; ???????  Collaboration  ??which is about leveraging the combined strength of Oracle; ???????  Communicating for Impact  ??which focuses on the need to communicate openly and effectively to influence others; ???????  Inspirational Leadership  ??about inspiring through your example; ???????  Competitive Edge ???to drive competitiveness and innovation; ???????  Change Agility  ??focused on driving and responding to change ???????  Mastering Complexity ???which is about making timely business decisions with sound judgement.

column1: Controllership Analyst - Finance Processes and Operations
column2: Skill required:Finance Processes and Operations - Finance Strategy  Designation:Controllership Analyst  Qualifications:BCom/Chartered Accountant/CA Inter  Years of Experience:3 to 5 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions. The team aligns Finance with Business Strategy in order to maximize operational efficiency and effectiveness by harnessing the power of robotics to accelerate transaction processing, with AI to provide analysis and commentary and machine learning deployed for matching and reconciliations This team is responsible for leading the transformation agenda for our clients by helping them improve finance function performance within the context of their organizations' strategies. The team leads growth and mining in existing F&A accounts for industry segments. This team works across Procure to Pay (PTP), Record to Report (RTR), Order to cash (OTC), Finance Processes (FPNA), Tax and Treasury towers to provide best in the class industry view, support existing engagements, diagnostic, due diligence, client co-design workshops, transformation engagement, drive existing client portfolios. The team works on Industry Digital F&A technologies & leading tools, automation, AI, and Analytics.  What are we looking for? Ability to meet deadlines  Ability to establish strong client relationship  Balance Sheet Account Reconciliations  Account Management  Finance Strategy  Financial Analysis Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of increasingly complex problems  Your day to day interactions are with peers within Accenture  You are likely to have some interaction with clients and/or Accenture management  You will be given minimal instruction on daily work/tasks and a moderate level of instruction on new assignments  Decisions that are made by you impact your own work and may impact the work of others  In this role you would be an individual contributor and/or oversee a small work effort and/or team  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column1: Financial plan and Analysis Analyst- Finance Processes
column2: Skill required:  Financial Planning & Analysis - Financial Analysis Designation:  Analyst Qualifications: Any Graduation,12th/PUC/HSC  Years of Experience: 3-5 yrs  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions. People in our Client Delivery &Operations career track drive delivery and capability excellence through the design, development and/or delivery of a solution, service, capability or offering. They grow into delivery-focused roles, and can progress within their current role, laterally or upward. You will be working as a part of Finance Processes team. The team is responsible for identifying new cross-sell opportunities, cutting report cycle time, increasing reporting accuracy and improves cash and capital forecasting. This team uses financial planning, reporting, variance analysis, budgeting and forecasting to help clients and organizations exercise and imply financial control. Business Process Specialization professionals apply expertise in a specific business process delivery capability (or capabilities) to ensure services are delivered in a manner consistent with our Standard Delivery Solutions and Service Level Agreements and drive continuous improvement. Design and implementation of tools and processes which enable the client to perform financial analysis of its statements. Involves the ability to assess materiality and volatility of financial statement line items and key metrics utilizing financial ratios to determine the financial health of the company. Analyst will be required to work independently in tight deadline situations with emphasis on quality of service delivered, ability to multi-task, deal with complex situations, close interaction with customer over video, phone and email. This position requires flexibility and adaptability in relation to working hours and changes thereto. What are we looking for? Ability to handle disputes , ability to meet deadlines, ability to perform under pressure, Adaptable and Flexible  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems  Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors  In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management  You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments  The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts  Prepare accruals and reclass JEs during month close process, and initiate corrections, if needed, to ensure the team meets the SLAs and work with other teams to ensure accurate accounting.  Review POs that have been raised for budget availability and title hygiene and communicate with requisitioner/ finance manager.  Prepare standard &ad hoc management reports for operating expense, capital expense and headcount with L1 commentary.  Track headcount and expense actuals and forecast against budget and manage cost center hygiene with respect to headcount and expenses.  Manage budget reallocations/ adjustments, track &manage approvals.  Support chart of accounts maintenance  Review large multi-year contracts for budget availability prior to PR set-up.  Manage client communication, respond to queries, investigate irregularities and anomalies and provide functional support for day-to-day issues.  Provide support to business units / regions with ad hoc requests and query resolution.  Support in reporting KPIs  Identify trends, inefficiencies and process standardization, automation and improvement opportunities.  Assist in implementing process improvements, and roll-out of new processes/ technology, etc. Qualification Any Graduation,12th/PUC/HSC
column11: financial analysis, forecasting, variance analysis, budgeting, financial planning, accounts receivable, accounts payable, mis reporting, accounting, financial control, financial management, fpa, financial planning and analysis, budget forecasting, finance

column2: Skill required:  Record To Report - Financial Consolidation & Close Operations Designation:  Record to Report Ops Senior Analyst Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 5 to 8 years  What would you do? The General Accounting Assistant Team Lead is responsible in assisting the Team Leader in delivering GA activities and making sure that the target will be met. Posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, preparing cash forecasting statement, supporting month end closing, preparing reports and supports in audits.The Financial Consolidation & Close Operations team is responsible for general ledger processes including year-end closing, journalizing, etc. They help create & maintain ledgers, currencies, budgets, & journal entries, deliver solutions including a flexible accounting structure, comprehensive journal processing, hierarchical summaries, intuitive inquiry & reporting, dynamic allocations & the management of commitments & expenditures, run interface reports & perform close books of accounts. The team reviews P&L accounts errors, omissions, or inconsistencies and managing the preparation of all reports. They also work on posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, investigating and reporting open items, reviewing entries and reconciliations, supporting month-end closing, preparing various reports as required, and supporting audits. The team also oversees improvement projects, including automation, simplifications, and enhanced controls. What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible Ability to perform under pressure Problem-solving skills Detail orientation Ability to establish strong client relationship RTR Process SLA/Metric Experience SAP Experiece non-standard/standard issues/problems on own initiative. ?Identifies and discusses with GA Lead which solutions/practices within an available range are the most applicable. ?May make decisions within parameters set by supervisor/manager, using job/specialist experience. ?Seeks advice and escalates issues when faced with tasks/problems outside normal scope of job.?Subject to general direction and guidance from manager as appropriate. ?Interacts with client/users around specific work efforts/deliverables. ?Coaches inexperienced team members. ?Develop thorough working knowledge of more than one functional area.?Development and maintenance of documentation on projects and team assignments.?Accurate, efficient and organized within daily responsibilities.?Adaptable to learn new processes, column2: Skill required:Record To Report - Financial Consolidation & Close Operations  Designation:Management Level - Analyst  Job Location:Bengaluru  Qualifications:B.B.M/BBA/BMM  Years of Experience:3 to 5 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions. The Record to Report team helps clients and organizations in their operational efficiency and balance sheet integrity, cuts time to close and safeguards compliance with regulatory requirements. The areas where this team's expertise lies is in posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, preparing cash forecasting statement, supporting month end closing, preparing reports and supports in audits. The Financial Consolidation & Close Operations team is responsible for general ledger processes including year-end closing, journalizing, etc. They help create & maintain ledgers, currencies, budgets, & journal entries, deliver solutions including a flexible accounting structure, comprehensive journal processing, hierarchical summaries, intuitive inquiry & reporting, dynamic allocations & the management of commitments & expenditures, run interface reports & perform close books of accounts. The team reviews P&L accounts errors, omissions, or inconsistencies and managing the preparation of all reports. They also work on posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, investigating and reporting open items, reviewing entries and reconciliations, supporting month-end closing, preparing various reports as required, and supporting audits. The team also oversees improvement projects, including automation, simplifications, and enhanced controls.  What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible  Ability to perform under pressure  Problem-solving skills  Detail orientation  Ability to establish strong client relationship Use of standard skill set using Accenture standard JD for all level 20% of team is required to have Oracle experince, rest 80% any SAP Experience in Oil & Gas / Heavy Machinery industry preferred Skill "Financial Planning & Analysis" only requires SAP experience B Com / MBA Finance 20% of team is required to have Oracle experince, rest 80% any SAP Roles and Responsibilities  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of lower-complexity problems  Your day to day interaction is with peers within Accenture before updating supervisors  In this role you may have limited exposure with clients and/or Accenture management  You will be given moderate level instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instructions on new assignments  The decisions you make impact your own work and may impact the work of others  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

Support business partner in Forecast and budget cycle including upload of number to tool. Ensure correct JE prepared and posted on time (Standard JE/ad-hoc JE) Handles queries & adhoc request from business partners. Good at stakeholder management, communication skill, Exposure interacting with international client Excellent knowledge of Excel (Knowledge on Power BI is an add) Knowledge of Excel Macro is an added advantage Willing to stretch during peak period  Flexible to work in any shift (Not rotational shift)Good Communication Skills and ability to resolve the queries independently.
