column2: As a Order-to-Cash Specialist, you will have responsibility and ownership for ensuring accurate invoicing to our clients for services provided and to process customer receipts     Someone who is highly organized and thrives in a fast-paced environment will do well in this position     Our most successful employees are service-oriented and work well as a team player           Some of the things you ll be doing:            Update and maintain files and documentation thoroughly and accurately, in accordance with company policy and accepted accounting practices          Ensure accurate and timely processing of new client contracts (in CRM and ERP)          Ensure accurate and timely processing of new client services, and other change requests including properly approved credit notes (in CRM and ERP)          Process annual indexation of client contracted fees          Maintain client master data management          Follow processes and procedures in order to complete billing tasks according to the quality standards          Daily processing and application of customer payments          Researching of issues related to unidentified payments          Processing of customer refunds related to duplicate or erroneous payments          Handling of credit card chargebacks and returned check deposits          Processing of adjustments related to cash posting discrepancies          Monitor weekly timely submission of timesheets          Support Business Units in researching and resolving invoice discrepancies and issues          Support Business Units with data management          Managing Finance e-mail boxes          Produce reports and analysis of Work In Progress (WIP)/Billing/receivables          Provide supporting documentation for audits            What technical skills, experience, and qualifications do you need        Graduate/Post Graduate with Accounting as a Major      8+ experience in order-to-cash process, with hands on experience of order management/project administration, customer invoicing      Strong communication skills, with proficiency in written and verbal English. Knowledge of additional languages would be a plus      Good understanding of the order-to-cash process      General knowledge of various banking transactions (ACH, Wire Transfer, Credit Card, etc.)      Knowledge of managing cash application with multiple foreign currency is a plus      Understanding of Shared Service Center finance End to End processes focusing on AR related tasks      Grasps accounting, auditing, and internal control concepts and can apply the same to CSC s business environment      Experience of working in an ERP environment; Preferably SAP or Oracle      Working knowledge of MS Office, with a good understanding of MS Excel                Other Skills          Must be tenacious and able to adapt to a challenging environment      Delivery oriented - committed to supporting and delivering quality outcome and able to drive stakeholders accordingly      Committed to delivering on time and meeting deadlines      Good team player - willing and able to assist the cash application team, working capital manager and work in cross-functional, cross -category teams      Attention to detail and responsiveness      Interpersonal skills - able to build strong relationships with internal stakeholders      Ability to interact and participate/lead meetings at any level      Self-starter - must have energy, confidence and ability to contribute to the process improvement

column2: This role will provide unique opportunities for learning key aspects of the credit ratings process including fundamental analysis of corporate borrowers across multiple industries in support of analysts primarily based in North America and Europe. You will be responsible for providing data, research and financial modeling support utilized to produce company and sector specific credit reports that incorporate creative insights and support activities across the ratings value chain. This position is based in our Navi Mumbai office.           Key Responsibilities:           Develop an understanding of and build proficiency in credit analysis.         Review credit documents, legal documentation, company presentation, credit memos, etc. to understand company structure, and/ or transaction being undertaken.         Apply financial and accounting principles to determine inputs for proprietary financial analysis tools and review the appropriateness of the results.         Carry out an assessment of a company s business as well as analyze corporate financial statements to develop, propose, and defend Credit Estimates as a Corporate Analyst for middle-market companies across various industries and jurisdictions.         Participate in analytical discussions with onshore analytical teams or senior analysts.         Track, review and maintain various operational databases to help support the credit rating process.         Provide research support and help collect, organize, and analyze data from internal and external sources for use in company-specific and others reports authored by the onshore analytical team         Ensure compliance with regulatory and company policies and procedures.               Requirements:           Postgraduate in Management (Finance) or CA or CFA charter holder or such equivalent qualification         Minimum of 2-3 years of relevant experience in capital markets, corporate credit analysis, analyzing credit risk of high yield or leveraged loan issuers, etc. or experience in auditing corporate financial statements at a nationally recognized accounting firm with CPA license.         Good understanding of core finance and accounting concepts         Knowledge of U.S. GAAP and/ or IFRS accounting rules is strongly desired.         Robust quantitative and analytical skills supported by strong attention to detail and accuracy.         Fluent in English, with strong verbal and written communication skills         Ability to work and deliver on time sensitive assignments with a daily turnaround.         Highly motivated, self-starter who is keen to learn, has a positive attitude and a strong work ethic.         Good inter-personal skills and ability to participate/ contribute as a team player

column2: Job Summary Controllership Accounting, Statutory and Reporting (CASR) is responsible for leading and delivery the close activities, local statutory audits, and tax compliance activities for worldwide entities. Tax Compliance COE (Tax COE) within the CASR COE is responsible for different tax compliance activities like providing information to our service providers for CIT filings, preparation of data required for transfer pricing documentation, USGAAP provision and related compliances. The recent addition of scope to this team is the performance of the accounts reconciliations for direct tax GLs which are currently outsourced. This position is for managing key activities for the Tax Compliance COE team for tax compliance activities mentioned above. This position is based out of Bangalore. Responsibilities  Leads and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and participates in cross-functional initiatives.  Acts as an expert providing direction and guidance to process improvements and establishing policies.  Collaborates with business leaders to guide and influence strategic decision-making within a broad scope. Broad role definition:   Manage to provide information for complex direct tax compliance requirements  Should be able to prepare complex US GAAP tax provision calculations.  Manage relationships between Tax, Controllership and Tax consultants.  Key team member who will be responsible for key tax compliance projects  Lead the review with the stakeholders (tax, controllership, auditors etc.)  Provide mentoring to the junior team members.  Conflict management and resolution  Manage optimization and automation goals.  Understand the underlying process to identify opportunities for efficiencies.  Ensure controls are established to validate the data that is being shared is accurate.  Regular progress updates to management.  Applies advanced subject matter knowledge, leads, and contributes to complex projects, and exercises independent judgment in resolving business issues and establishing policies.  Develops and builds productive internal/external working relationships and provides mentoring and guidance to lower-level employees. Education & Experience Recommended Finance professional, CA with 10+ years of work experience preferably in financial management, internal audit, accounting, or a related field or an advanced degree with 15 years of work experience. Preferred Certifications  Certified Public Accountant (CPA)  Certified Financial Analyst (CFA) Knowledge & Skills  Accounting  Automation  Corporate Finance  SAP Applications  Variance Analysis Accounting and Tax domain knowledge. Willingness to understand complex system and processes within the company. Proven ability to work to stringent deadlines. Effective communicator with skills to sustain work environment towards accomplishment of organizational goals. Advanced skills in using SAP/S4 HANA Ability to challenge the status quo and find easier more digitized ways of delivering results. Strong communication and influencing skills. column2: The Lab is seeking a talented and motivated Senior Analyst or Manager to build, represent, and help lead the          of the Global Innovation Lab for Climate Finance. In addition, this role will contribute to the successful development of climate finance instruments for the Lab Program in India, as well as replication and scale-up of proven financial solutions from the Lab portfolio.         The Sr. Analyst/Manager will work in collaboration with the Global Lab Associate Director and work closely with a range of national and international partners from the policy, finance, and corporate spheres, as well as with CPI teams in India and across the world.         The Sr. Analyst/Manager will work closely with Lab Analysts and consultants the Lab Communications Manager, Portfolio Manager, and Project Manager, drawing on robust and careful analysis, including methodologies from economics, public policy, finance, and other academic and commercial disciplines the Sr. Analyst/Manager may bring to the table.         The successful candidate will bring strong knowledge of India s national climate and economic development priorities, as well as key climate policy frameworks and market conditions impacting the region more broadly. Knowledge of development finance and blended finance structures are a plus. The Sr. Analyst/Manager should also bring an exceptional grasp of the policy, grant funder, and private investor stakeholder landscapes in India, and ideally will hold relationships with key actors.         ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES         Including the following and others as required:               Work closely with international partners from the policy, finance, and corporate spheres, as well as with CPI teams throughout the world in instrument development and working group management tasks.                 Lead business development and strategy to improve the Labs presence and impact in India.                 Build and maintain relationships with stakeholders in the climate, agriculture, and renewable energy sectors, and provide advice and support to Lab and CPI Senior Management                 Oversee continued support activities for Lab instruments, including oversight of deliverables, events, and managing investor outreach                 Deliver high-quality outputs on time and within a budget                 Support collaborate with Lab Sr. Program Associate, Technical Lead, Associate Director other key Lab staff           QUALIFICATIONS EXPERIENCE               Post- graduate in finance, economics, management, environment, public policy, land-use or equivalent. Preferably with a graduation with engineering.                  Progressively senior experience in climate finance, development finance, management consulting, policy, and/or energy markets and/or sustainable land use                 Private sector experience, preferably in the financial sector and/or government or multilateral experience is highly valuable                 Advanced knowledge of Indian policy environment, energy markets, sustainable transport, and/or key sustainable land-use and agriculture issues                 Familiarity with climate adaptation issues and concepts strongly preferred                 Familiarity with blended finance instruments / approaches strongly preferred

column2: BSK Engineering Services is looking for Dissolved Ozone Analyzer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      A Dissolved Ozone Analyzer is a device used to measure the concentration of ozone gas dissolved in a liquid, typically water      Ozone (O3) is often used in water treatment processes due to its powerful disinfection properties      Dissolved ozone analyzers are crucial for monitoring and controlling ozone levels in water treatment applications to ensure effective disinfection while avoiding overexposure, which can be harmful      These analyzers typically work by extracting a sample of the water being tested and then subjecting it to a measurement process that determines the concentration of ozone present      This measurement process can vary depending on the specific design of the analyzer but often involves techniques such as ultraviolet (UV) absorption spectroscopy or amperometric measurement      Key features of dissolved ozone analyzers may include:Measurement Range: The range of ozone concentrations that the analyzer can accurately measure      Accuracy and Precision: The degree of accuracy and precision with which the analyzer can measure ozone concentrations      Response Time: The time it takes for the analyzer to provide a measurement after taking a sample      Sample Handling: How the analyzer handles samples, including factors such as sample volume and sample preparation requirements      Calibration: Procedures for calibrating the analyzer to ensure accurate measurements      Data Logging and Connectivity: Whether the analyzer can log measurement data and connect to external systems for data storage or analysis      Maintenance Requirements: The frequency and complexity of maintenance tasks required to keep the analyzer functioning properly

column2: Acuity Knowledge Partners Acuity Knowledge Partners (Acuity) is a leading provider of bespoke research, analytics and technology solutions to the financial services sector, including asset managers, corporate and investment banks, private equity and venture capital firms, hedge funds and consulting firms. Its global network of over 6,000 analysts and industry experts, combined with proprietary technology, supports more than 500 financial institutions and consulting companies to operate more efficiently and unlock their human capital, driving revenue higher and transforming operations. Acuity is headquartered in London and operates from 10 locations worldwide.  The company fosters a diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment, nurturing talent, regardless of race, gender, ethnicity or sexual orientation. Acuity was established as a separate business from Moodys Corporation in 2019, following its acquisition by Equistone Partners Europe (Equistone). In January 2023, funds advised by global private equity firm Permira acquired a majority stake in the business from Equistone, which remains invested as a minority shareholder. For more information, visit www.acuitykp.com   Job Purpose     Financial statements are to be prepared as IFRS requirements and adherence to generally accepted accounting principles and audit for the console entities at group and standalone entities. Books are closed as per the timelines and in compliance with business accounting policies. column1: Tax Consultant - 1 year C2H-Navi Mumbai-Immediate Joiners only
column2: Immediate Opening for "TAX Consultant" -  ONLY IMMEDIATE JOINERS APPLY Initially Contract for 1 year, Later they will extend depends on Performance. Location: Navi Mumbai Exp: 3 + years Package: Open Qualification:  Bcom with 3+ years of strong experience in  GST  with a working knowledge of FP&A function. Note: Excellent Work experience in GST  Department:  Shared Services Centre   Role:  This role includes FP&A function for Company's trading/ agency business (25%) and an expert for GST (75%)   Location:  Navi Mumbai  Experience:  mentioned above.  Objectives   of   the   position: Work closely with the Assistant Manager Tax / Manager Tax to ensure that tax compliances are performed as per due dates. Collect data for submission to tax officers as per the requirements. Work with the consultant to maintain a high level of follow up and timely approach for closure of tax litigations.   Initiate the activities in financial planning and controlling programs to prepare for product / sector reporting, budgeting, working capital control relating to the  Trading business .     Representative of Main Tasks:   Present   scope:   All the activities are done for three legal entities in India.   Compliance   requirements   Ensure that all the taxes are paid as per due date. Facilitate and manage the preparation and review company tax returns and the accurate, timely filing of all tax forms. Find and implement opportunities for process improvement in Company tax procedures. Co-ordinate collection of data used to evaluate business performance. Consolidate and prepare the data for reporting on business performance to business managers / relevant users.   Analyze the reports according to agreed business operation objectives/ measurements and alert the businesses of deviations.   Internal   reporting   and   follow   up:   Ensure that reconciliation of tax returns with GL is done every month from GST perspective. Control the process surrounding transfer prices, commissions, rebates and credit notes to sales office.     Annual   Audit:   Liaise and work closely with internal and external auditors to understand and ensure the company policies/ procedures/ practices fully meet the relevant requirements. To prepare the relevant schedules and provide supporting documentation to address queries.     Mid-term   Forecast/   operational   planning   and   budget   preparation:   Co-ordinate, collect and consolidate the budget data to prepare monthly budgets of the product segments. Prepare monthly / quarterly forecasts as per business needs.   Key Responsibilities (in brief):   Support the activities of Assistant Manager Tax / Manager Tax. Delivering full range of tax services (finance related) in compliance with laws and regulations applicable to the Company either individually or with the help of consultant. Accurately preparing and filing tax returns as per due date. Maintain effective control over all aspects of the tax process. Work with consultants to ensure that tax litigations are closed with minimal impact to Company. Has an understanding of the underlying accounting transactions which lead to tax responsibilities. Collect data for submissions to tax officers as per need. Reconciliation of tax returns with corresponding GLs in SAP.   Competencies   Good knowledge of SAP is must Hands on Has working knowledge of tax rules.   Interested Candidates share your updated profile to ssathi@primusglobal.com

column2: A career in our Deals Strategy and Operation practice, within Deals Transaction Services, will provide you with the opportunity to help the team build, develop, manage and run strategic capacity which will undoubtedly benefit both PwC and our clients     As an indispensable part of the team, you will cooperate with other business units to boost strategic capacity in the team and stay close connection with clients to better meet their demands     In short, you are expected to strengthen the bond and establish mutual understanding between PwC and our clients through releasing every team members potential abilities and generating remarkable business value for the clients         SUMMARY OF THE ROLE         The role will be to work in the Capital Markets Advisory team of PWC and get involved in doing the diagnostic study of potential IPO aspirants.      In some cases, the companies may also go in for private funding, but the preparation is the same.      The candidate will also be part of the project management team to work on behalf of the client in managing the IPO timetable.      Besides managing the investor relations post IPO and helping the company maximizing its market cap will be an important milestone of the role.      Team management experience even if it is a small team would be an added advantage.       MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES     IPO DIAGNOSTIC:       To deep dive on each of the financial statements processes of the a company and identify gaps from policies, SOP s etc. closing time table, adequacy of controls, ERP etc.     To check on the information system preparedness across the company     To check on the ERP being used across functions in the Organization and check its adequacy.     To work on the compliance checklist of the client and check for adequacy of compliance.     To go through the risk profile of the Company from a ERM perspective.     To work with the ESG team on a ESG strategy.     To look for opportunities in operations improvement, revenue acceleration, and cost optimization.       PROJECT MANAGEMENT:       To work as a conduit between client team and IPO consultants and ensure we stick to the time table.     To vet the data given by the client before the same is passed on to the consultants.     To be the point of solution for all consultant needs from the client in a IPO War room.       INVESTOR RELATIONS:       To work with client on their quarterly presentations to Board/investors.     To help set up the quarterly analyst call and post analyst call transcripts     To work with the client to improve sell side coverage.     To line up buy side investors for the client and engage in continuous discussion with     existing investors.     To work on perception study about the client with market participants.     To work on peer benchmarking analysis and reports.       QUALIFICATION       CA with 5-12 years of post-qualification experience and having worked either in a IPO or in a listed company handling multiple stakeholders including investor community.           Required Skill Set   Financial Acumen:         In-depth understanding of financial statements and accounting principles.     Ability to perform financial analysis and interpret complex financial data.       IPO and Capital Markets Knowledge:       Comprehensive knowledge of the IPO process and capital markets regulations.     Experience in guiding clients through the IPO journey, including due diligence, prospectus preparation, and regulatory compliance.       Project Management:         Proven ability to manage complex projects and multitask effectively.     Strong organizational skills to ensure timely and accurate delivery of services.       Communication Skills:         Excellent written and verbal communication skills for client interactions and report writing.     Ability to convey complex financial information in a clear and concise manner.       Client Relationship Management:         Strong client-facing skills with the ability to build and maintain client relationships.     Understanding of client needs and ability to tailor services accordingly.       Regulatory Compliance:       Stay updated on relevant financial regulations and compliance requirements.     Ensure clients adhere to regulatory standards throughout the IPO process.     Problem-Solving:     Critical thinking and problem-solving skills to address complex financial and strategic issues.     Ability to provide innovative solutions to meet client objectives.       Industry Knowledge:       Familiarity with the industry in which the client operates, understanding market trends, and competitor landscape.       Adaptability:       Ability to adapt to changes in project scope or client requirements.     Agility to navigate through dynamic market conditions.       Negotiation Skills:       Effective negotiation skills for dealing with various stakeholders involved in the IPO process.     Ethical and Professional Conduct:     High ethical standards and adherence to professional conduct.     Compliance with firm policies and regulations.       Networking:       Proactive networking skills to expand the client base and build relationships within the industry.

MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES    IPO DIAGNOSTIC:        To deep dive on each of the financial statements & processes of the a company and    identify gaps from policies, SOP s etc. closing time table, adequacy of controls, ERP    etc.    To check on the information system preparedness across the company      To check on the ERP being used across functions in the Organization and check its    adequacy.        To work on the compliance checklist of the client and check for adequacy of    compliance.        To go through the risk profile of the Company from a ERM perspective.        To work with the ESG team on a ESG strategy.    To look for opportunities in operations improvement, revenue      acceleration, and cost    optimization.    PROJECT MANAGEMENT:        To work as a conduit between client team and IPO consultants and ensure we stick    to the time table.        To vet the data given by the client before the same is passed on to the consultants.        To be the point of solution for all consultant needs from the client in a IPO War    room.    INVESTOR RELATIONS:        To work with client on their quarterly presentations to Board/investors.    To help set up the quarterly analyst call and post analyst call transcripts        To work with the client to improve sell side coverage.        To line up buy side investors for the client and engage in continuous discussion with    existing investors.        To work on perception study about the client with market participants.        To work on peer benchmarking analysis and reports.        QUALIFICATION    CA with 5-12 years of post-qualification experience and having worked either in a    IPO or in a listed company handling multiple stakeholders including investor    community.      Required Skill Set        Financial Acumen:        In-depth understanding of financial statements and accounting principles.        Ability to perform financial analysis and interpret complex financial data.    IPO and Capital Markets Knowledge:    Comprehensive knowledge of the IPO process and capital markets regulations.        Experience in guiding clients through the IPO journey, including due diligence, prospectus    preparation, and regulatory compliance.        Project Management:        Proven ability to manage complex projects and multitask effectively.        Strong organizational skills to ensure timely and accurate delivery of services.        Communication Skills:        Excellent written and verbal communication skills for client interactions and report writing.        Ability to convey complex financial information in a clear and concise manner.        Client Relationship Management:        Strong client-facing skills with the ability to build and maintain client relationships.        Understanding of client needs and ability to tailor services accordingly.        Regulatory Compliance:        Stay updated on relevant financial regulations and compliance requirements.        Ensure clients adhere to regulatory standards throughout the IPO process.    Problem-Solving:        Critical thinking and problem-solving skills to address complex financial and strategic issues.    Ability to provide innovative solutions to meet client objectives.    Industry Knowledge:      Familiarity with the industry in which the client operates, understanding market trends, and    competitor landscape.        Adaptability:        Ability to adapt to changes in project scope or client requirements.        Agility to navigate through dynamic market conditions.          Negotiation Skills:          Effective negotiation skills for dealing with various stakeholders involved in the IPO process.        Ethical and Professional Conduct:        High ethical standards and adherence to professional conduct.        Compliance with firm policies and regulations.    Networking:        Proactive networking skills to expand the client base and build relationships within the industry.                                Mandatory Skill Set-        IPo knowledge          Preferred Skill Set-        IPO experience          Year of experience required-        4-6          Qualifications-        CA

column2: Role   & responsibilities        Analytical Skills: The ability to analyze data, identify trends, and draw   meaningful insights is crucial for an MIS Executive. This includes   proficiency in tools like Excel, SWOT Analysis, SCC Clouad Software, SAP_ Analytical Tool MIS Reporting   and Analysis and possibly more specialized BI (Business Intelligence)   tools.       Production/Inventory : Should be able to work with Inventory and prodution   team to ensure invoice generation, stock management etc...       Technical Proficiency: Strong proficiency in relevant software and tools   used for data management and reporting is essential. This may include Excel,   SQL, Tableau, Power BI, etc. Familiarity with database management systems may   also be necessary.       Data Management: Knowledge of how to collect, organize, and manage large   volumes of data efficiently is crucial. This includes data cleansing,   validation, and transformation.       Attention to Detail: MIS Executives deal with large datasets, and accuracy   is paramount. Small errors in data can lead to incorrect conclusions and   decisions.       Problem-Solving Skills: The ability to identify and rectify data-related   issues or discrepancies is important. This may involve debugging queries,   finding patterns in data, or troubleshooting software.       Communication Skills: An MIS Executive often needs to communicate complex   data insights to non-technical stakeholders. The ability to present   information in a clear and understandable way is vital.       Time Management: Prioritizing tasks, meeting deadlines, and managing   workload efficiently is important in a role that often involves handling   multiple projects simultaneously.       Business Acumen: Understanding the business context in which the MIS is   being used is crucial. This allows the executive to focus on the most   relevant data and provide insights that are aligned with organizational   goals.       Domain Knowledge: Familiarity with the FMCG industry or sector can be   beneficial. It helps in contextualizing data and understanding specific   requirements.
column11: Power BI, Finance Analysis, SAP Analytical Tool, Sales, Analysis, Production, Data Management, stock management, Tableau, SWOT Analysis, MIS Reporting

column2: About the Role: We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced  Senior Core Valuation & M&A Audit Specialist  to play a pivotal role in our growing audit practice. You will be a key contributor, focusing on clients in the Service, Manufacturing, and Distribution industries with complex transactions and international operations. This role demands a deep understanding of valuation methodologies and proven expertise in applying them to Core Valuation, Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) audits. A strong grasp of  either  Indian Accounting Standards (Ind AS) or Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (US GAAP) is essential for seamless collaboration with our respective teams. Experience with both is a plus. Key Skills & Experience: CA (Chartered Accountant) qualification with 4-5 years of experience in public accounting, with a demonstrated track record in  both core valuation and M&A audits .  Experience in the Service, Manufacturing, and/or Distribution industries is a plus. Highly Skilled In Excel. Proven expertise in leading and performing  valuation audits , including fair value measurements, impairment testing, and applying results to M&A transactions. In-depth knowledge of various valuation methodologies applicable to different asset classes and industries. Extensive experience in performing due diligence procedures for M&A transactions, with a focus on both valuation and broader audit considerations. Strong understanding of  either  Ind AS (for India) or US GAAP (for US) as they relate to valuation for M&A purposes and M&A audit procedures. Expertise in using Excel for complex financial modeling and data analysis to support valuations and M&A audits. Responsibilities: Lead and execute all aspects of core valuation and M&A audits for clients in the Service, Manufacturing, and Distribution industries. Perform comprehensive core valuation procedures within the context of M&A audits, considering industry-specific factors and relevant methodologies. Analyze complex financial data and prepare detailed reports to support both valuations and M&A audit conclusions. Assist with due diligence activities for M&A transactions, focusing on both valuation issues and broader audit considerations. Collaborate seamlessly with engagement teams across India and the US to ensure consistent application of valuation methodologies, audit procedures, and accounting standards. Stay up-to-date on the latest valuation pronouncements, M&A audit best practices, and industry trends. Develop strong relationships with clients and provide them with valuable insights and guidance on valuation, M&A activity, and the overall audit process.
column11: Valuation, DCF VALUATION, Expert Excel Reporting, core valuation, Transfer Pricing, Financial Statements, Chartered Accountant, Mergers And Acquisitions, Excel Report Preparation

column2: Job Overview We are searching for an experienced and detail-oriented candidate to join us as GL Accountant. As a  General Ledger (GL) Accountant , you will be responsible for maintaining general ledger entries and reconciling financial statements. You will also be responsible for ensuring that the ledger data is accurate and precise.  Ideally, you should be working in collaboration with the various departments for accounting data. In addition to this, you should possess excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities. Prior working experience as a GL Accountant will be mandatory for this position. Responsibilities Preparing and managing general ledger entries., recording monthly and annual processes. Reconciling financial statement, ensuring precise data entry. Entering financial data in deferrals, accruals, and reclassifications. Preparing balance sheet and profit and loss statement. Interpreting and analyzing financial information. Staying updated with the best practices in accounting. Preferred candidates From Big 4's 3+ Yrs of relevant Experience Required

column2: About NCR Atleos                                                                                      NCR Atleos,  headquartered in Atlanta,  is a leader in expanding financial access.  Our dedicated 20, 000 employees optimize the branch,  improve operational efficiency and maximize self-service availability for financial institutions and retailers across the globe.           K  ey responsibilities associated with this position:          Invoice Processing and Payment:            The Accounts Payable Manager oversees the processing of invoices received from vendors and suppliers.  They ensure that invoices are accurately recorded,  approved,  and paid on time.             This involves verifying the accuracy of invoice details,  matching them with purchase orders or contracts,  and resolving any discrepancies.                 Vendor Management:            The manager maintains relationships with vendors and suppliers.  They negotiate payment terms,  resolve payment issues,  and address any concerns.             Effective communication with vendors is essential to maintain positive relationships and ensure smooth transactions.                 Financial Record Keeping:            The Accounts Payable Manager ensures accurate record-keeping.  They maintain a ledger of all payables,  track expenses,  and reconcile accounts.             This information is crucial for financial reporting,  audits,  and budgeting.                 Payment Disbursement:            Managing payment disbursement is a key responsibility.  The manager ensures that payments are made via checks,  electronic funds transfers (EFT),  or other methods.             They prioritize payments based on due dates,  cash flow,  and organizational priorities.                 Compliance and Internal Controls:            The manager ensures compliance with company policies,  accounting standards,  and legal requirements.             They implement internal controls to prevent fraud,  errors,  and duplicate payments.                 Team Leadership and Supervision:            The Accounts Payable Manager leads a team responsible for invoice processing,  data entry,  and payment coordination.             They provide guidance,  training,  and performance evaluations for team members.                 Reporting and Analysis:            Regular reporting on accounts payable metrics,  aging reports,  and outstanding liabilities is part of the role.             The manager analyzes trends,  identifies areas for improvement,  and collaborates with other departments to optimize processes.                 In summary,  an Accounts Payable Manager ensures the smooth flow of financial transactions,  maintains accurate records,  and fosters positive relationships with vendors.  They contribute to the overall financial health of the organization by managing payables efficiently.  Is there anything else you d like to know?      Offers of employment are conditional upon passage of screening criteria applicable to the job.                                                                                           EEO Statement                                                                                    NCR Atleos is an equal-opportunity employer.  It is NCR Atleos policy to hire,  train,  promote,  and pay associates based on their job-related qualifications,  ability,  and performance,  without regard to race,  color,  creed,  religion,  national origin,  citizenship status,  sex,  sexual orientation,  gender identity/expression,  pregnancy,  marital status,  age,  mental or physical disability,  genetic information,  medical condition,  military or veteran status,  or any other factor protected by law.                                                                                         Statement to Third Party Agencies                                                                                        To ALL recruitment agencies: NCR Atleos only accepts resumes from agencies on the NCR Atleos preferred supplier list.  Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system,  NCR Atleos employees,  or any NCR Atleos facility.  NCR Atleos is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.

column2: Skill required:Procure to Pay Processing - Invoice Processing Operations  Designation:Procure to Pay Operations New Associate  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:0 to 1 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Finance Operations vertical and will be helping us in determining financial outcomes by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions. The Record to Report team helps clients and organizations in their operational efficiency and balance sheet integrity, cuts time to close and safeguards compliance with regulatory requirements. The areas where this team's expertise lies is in posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, preparing cash forecasting statement, supporting month end closing, preparing reports and supports in audits. The Financial Tracking and Reporting team focuses on providing the financial controls and reporting in order to effectively manage CFM activities. This includes providing project-level cost and expense reporting, invoice generation and tracking, project financial tracking, reporting and analytics. The role requires a good understanding of general ledger, balance sheet, statutory reporting, client reporting, fund reporting, Financial Planning & Analysis (FPNA), budgeting and forecasting.  What are we looking for? Ability to perform under pressure  Adaptable and flexible  Problem-solving skills  Detail orientation  Ability to establish strong client relationship Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines  Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor  You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments  The decisions that you make would impact your own work  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column2: Blis is looking for a Financial Planning and Analyst Specialist based in Mumbai working for our EMEA,APAC and US subsidiaries.            The Financial Planning and Analyst will play a crucial role in supporting business decisions by collaborating with various teams to provide essential commercial finance analysis.              The role involves producing weekly sales reports, preparing a three-month revenue outlook, and issuing these to senior management.              Additionally, the analyst will review and prepare global monthly analysis packs and support the Senior FP&A Manager in producing monthly board packs.                  Key Responsibilities               Collaborate with teams to provide essential commercial finance analysis.          Produce weekly sales reports and a three-month revenue outlook, issuing them to senior management.          Review and prepare global monthly analysis packs.          Support the Senior FP&A Manager in producing monthly board packs.          Work closely with the Commercial Finance Controller/Finance Business Partner to prepare ad hoc analysis.          Assist in managing the CRM system to ensure all information is correct and up to date.          Identify and research variances to forecast, budget, and prior year.          Produce monthly ROI reports.            Support the creation of monthly country packs containing financial and operational data specific to each country or region where the company operates.                          Skills and requirements               CA,CPA qualified with 3+ years of experience in financial analysis or related roles          Analytical Skills: Strong quantitative and analytical abilities, with the ability to interpret complex financial data and draw meaningful conclusions.          Technical Proficiency: Proficient in financial modeling, data analysis tools (eg, Excel, Tableau), and familiarity with ERP and financial software.          Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey financial insights and recommendations to non-financial stakeholders.          Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and reliability in financial analysis and reporting.          Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment and adapt to evolving business needs.          Problem Solving: Proactive problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and propose innovative solutions.

column2: Finance Analyst analyst is a versatile role that contributes significantly to the financial health and success of the organization. They provide critical financial insights, analysis, and reporting, collaborating with various teams and senior management to facilitate data-driven decision-making and support strategic initiatives. Their responsibilities encompass a wide range of financial analysis, reporting, forecasting, and strategic support functions.                  Key Responsibilities               Supporting Business Decisions:       collaborates with various departments within the organization to provide valuable insights and data-driven analysis. They use financial data to help stakeholders make informed decisions that align with the companys goals and objectives.           Revenue and Client Reporting:       responsible for preparing regular and insightful reports on revenue and client-related metrics. These reports assist in tracking performance, identifying trends, and highlighting areas for improvement.           Revenue Forecasting:       The Finance Analyst is tasked with forecasting revenue on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis. Accurate revenue forecasting helps the company plan and allocate resources effectively.           Monthly Board Packs:       supports the creation and distribution of monthly board packs. These packs typically contain key financial and operational information that is presented to the companys board of directors.           Commercial Finance Support:       works closely with the Commercial Finance Controller, providing analysis and insights on various financial matters as required.           Analytics Dashboard Management:        responsible for managing the Analytics Dashboard on the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system. This dashboard provides crucial data and analysis to the Head of Sales, Managing Director, and executive team, helping them monitor performance and make strategic decisions.           Budgeting Process:       assists in the yearly budgeting process. This involves collaborating with different departments to create detailed budgets that align with the companys overall financial strategy.           Monthly KPI Analysis:       The Finance Analyst produces monthly Key Performance Indicator (KPI) analysis, which includes metrics like Seller Return on Investment (ROI) and Gross Profit (GP) analysis. These KPIs offer valuable insights into the companys financial performance and help identify areas for improvement.           Adhoc Projects and Analysis:       t undertakes ad hoc projects and analysis work as directed by the Finance Director (FD) or Chief Financial Officer (CFO). These projects could involve financial modeling, cost analysis, or strategic planning.           Monthly Country Packs:       supports the creation and distribution of Monthly Country Packs. These packs likely contain financial and operational data specific to each country or region where the company operates.               Skills and requirements             CA,CPA qualified with 3+ years of experience in financial analysis or related roles         Analytical Skills: Strong quantitative and analytical abilities, with the ability to interpret complex financial data and draw meaningful conclusions.         Technical Proficiency: Proficient in financial modeling, data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau), and familiarity with ERP and financial software.         Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to effectively convey financial insights and recommendations to non-financial stakeholders.         Attention to Detail: Meticulous attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and reliability in financial analysis and reporting.         Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment and adapt to evolving business needs.         Problem Solving: Proactive problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and propose innovative solutions.

column1: Oracle Fusion Financial Accounting and Subledger Functional Specialist
column2: We are looking for an Oracle Fusion Cloud Financial Accounting and Subledger functional analysts to join our ERP team. The candidate shall supervise business requirements by leading functional design and process design stages of Oracle Cloud General Ledger, Subledger Accounting and transaction accounting definitions with US GAAP and GASB compliance reporting and implementations. The person shall provide thought leadership and guidance to clients to implement modern best practices and functionality of Oracle cloud applications with accounting background. Serve as a leader, collaborate, and communicate effectively among client stakeholders and project team members to mitigate risks, enable transformation, define business outcomes, document change impacts for better user adoption and successful deployment. Job Responsibilities: Analyze business processes and assist clients in transforming their current general ledger and subledger accounting business processes to Oracle Cloud General Ledger and Subledger systems Management application. Provide thought leadership around industry leading practices for improving operational efficiencies and profitability of client business. Design, prototype, and iterate solutions in Oracle for Federal, State and Local clients to resolve pain points and achieve customer satisfaction. Configure Oracle General Ledger Cloud based on business requirements and functional design including subledger accounting mapping, integrations and accounting compliance reporting. Perform month-end, quarter-end, and year-end close activities including the subledger accounting integration/reconciliation automation and monitoring support services. Lead and manage a small team as required by the project. Subject matter expertise in Financial reporting  trial balance, profit/loss statements, annual comprehensive financial reporting, financial budget variance reporting, forecast reporting and subledger/general ledger reconciliation reporting with Procurement, Accounts Payable, Fixed Assets, Project Portfolio Management, Payroll, Receivables, Procurement Cards, Treasury and Third-party applications. Subject matter expertise in OTBI, SmartView, Financial Reporting, Business Intelligence reporting and Financial analytics warehouse reporting requirements and enhancements support. Responsible for capturing business requirements, functional design, configuration, PaaS extensions, data conversions, integrations and reporting.  Prepare training materials and SOPs to help train the end users and validate solutions. Provide status updates to internal teams, client teams and executive leadership throughout the project. Stay updated on the latest Oracle Financial Close Automation and Reconciliation trends to provide the best practical solutions to clients. Required Qualifications: 5+ years of Oracle Fusion ERP Financials and Payroll Accounting Cloud implementation and/or support experience. Integration experience with third party accounting systems and reporting related applications. Strong experience in all functional aspects of cloud application; requirements gathering, functional design, conversion, configuration, PaaS extensions, validation testing, integration, and deployment. Strong experience in US GAAP, GASB, and Annual Comprehensive Financial Reporting. Oracle General Ledger application implementation and support experience in with general ledger accounting setups, monitoring, ledgers, chart of account segments, cross validation rules, allocations, workflows, subledger accounting mapping and TAD alignments with subledger systems. Extensive experience with subledger accounting integration with month-end, quarter-end and year-end close activities monitoring and automation. Oracle Certification in Oracle Fusion General Ledger and subsystem modules such as Payables, Fixed Assets, PPM, Receivables, Treasury, Procurement and others would be an added advantage. Experience in Oracle Cloud OTBI, BI Publisher, and other Reporting tools is a plus. Excellent verbal and written communication along with strong analytical skills
column11: Oracle Fusion Financials, Oracle Cloud, Oracle ERP

column2: Revenue assurance team at Paytm comprises seasoned professionals with diverse skill sets and experience across different verticals like accounting ,billing, collection, MIS reporting , identification of revenue leakage, validation of contract from revenue POV and are responsible for identifying oppurtunities for improvement in company revenue and processes      The team focuses on developing new strategies to improve accuracy, timeliness of revenue management and ensuring revenue is reported as per appropriate accounting standard         About the Role:       1. Responsible for identifying areas of improvement in company revenues and margins     2. In order to: identify potential risk areas on revenue /Cost / margin, define and implement new controls and analysis on new Offers and Capabilities, New System Integrations , creating queries, reports and dashboards      3. Perform recurring controls to verify the completeness and correctness of the Billing on a sample of customers or merchants , select the sample in order to assure a proper coverage, manage the communication and follow ups with relevant team of the potential issues identified     4. Revenue Assurance platforms / solutions knowledge     5. Strong skills in Data Analysis and drawing insights     6. Excellent use of Excel, Access, SQL etc     7. Data crunching and SQL writing skills along with data analytics for Revenue and Costs     8. Recommends actions by analysing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses for B2C and B2B businesses     9. Experience in various internal and external audit closures             Superpowers/ Skills that will help you succeed in this role:       1. Minimum 4 years of experience in relevant role.     2. Ability to think campaigns as well as tactical day-to-day creative needs      3. Experience of executing core Finance & engagement processes while leading/ working with a team     4. Good analytical and numerical ability     5. Expertise on MS Excel and MS PowerPoint.     6. SAP and any ERP tool experience is mandatory.             Education:       Graduate or Post-graduate/ MBA

column1: Record To Report Ops Senior Analyst
column2: Skill required:  Record To Report - Accounting & Financial Reporting Standards Designation:  Record to Report Ops Senior Analyst Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 5 to 8 years  What would you do? Determining financials by collecting operational data/reports, whilst conducting analysis and reconciling transactions  Cash Management:Process JE's, Bank upload journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations.  Responsible for general ledger processes including Monthly, quarterly, half yearly and year-end closing, journalizing, etc Intercompany Accounting:Intercompany Account Reconciliation which involves recording & reconciliation of transactions, also includes assuring that transactional relationships between the entities are in balance. Performing Netting and settlement of IC transactions Fixed Asset Accounting:Perform and complete Capitalization requests, additions, transfers and disposals, perform depreciation runs, roll forwards, perform reconciliations and provide sudit support etc.  Review P&L accounts errors, omissions, or inconsistencies and managing the preparation of all reports. Master Data Management:Receive and validate and maintain master data requests and prepare reports.  Identify improvement projects, including automation, simplifications, and enhanced controls.The Financial Tracking and Reporting team focuses on providing the financial controls and reporting in order to effectively manage CFM activities. This includes providing project-level cost and expense reporting, invoice generation and tracking, project financial tracking, reporting and analytics. The role requires a good understanding of general ledger, balance sheet, statutory reporting, client reporting, fund reporting, Financial Planning & Analysis (FPNA), budgeting and forecasting. What are we looking for? Qualifications: Minimum 6 8 years of Record to Report experience in Finance & Accounting function CA Intermediate pass candidates :5 - 8 years of experience  BPO experience will be an added advantage but not mandatory.  Minimum Bachelor's degree in Finance Accounting or MBA FinannceSystem & applications Experience working in SAP ERP,Blackline & Other Technologies would be preferred and added advantage. Sound knowledge of MS Excel & word. Having advanced Excel knowledge would be an added advantage.Communication & Interpersonal skills Ability to interact with customers for daily operational activities with client SME Excellent in communication skills both oral and written as needed to interact with customers/internal stakeholders via calls and e-mails. Closely work with team lead to drive process/organizational initiative  Must be able to communicate both orally and in writing with client Reconciliations SME and 3rdparties involved and can raise timely and accurate queries  Roles and Responsibilities: Understanding of various account reconciliations (Bank / Balance sheet / GL account/Store accounts) on a frequency level of daily/weekly/monthly  Perform variance analysis and provide reason codes for open items Perform month end closing as per the agreed schedule Work on open items resolutions received, raise appropriate queries if required to clients and 3rdparties Prepare and post journals with prior approvals from clients/team leads Achieve 100% accuracy & productivity for activities in scope. Perform quality check for reconciliation, queries raised to the client or 3rd parties and share the results with SME. Interact with client SMEs, Lead for daily work and process related issues and work on open items resolutions received, raise appropriate queries if required to clients and 3rd parties Must possess good communication skills both e-mail and oral Participate in the weekly/daily calls with Client SMEs and ensure timely action on pending action items.  Generate lean ideas and provide inputs to process leads for improvement opportunities.  Generate lean ideas and process improvements and deliver improved process controls, productivity, and accuracy. Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Skill required:  Property & Casualty- Underwriting - Underwriting Designation:  Underwriting Sr. Analyst Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 5 to 8 years  What would you do? The selected persons should be willing to perform such projects / tasks which provides them an overview of the work in the General Accounting services area for retail business. Identified individuals should understand the client business, technology, process details and procedures. This role consist of recording, monitoring and reporting Asset Acquisition / Creation, Transfer/ Retirement/ Impairment, Depreciation and completing all month end activities including Reconciliations. You will be responsible for monitoring projects in Fixed assets Capital WIP account and ensuring appropriate accounting treatment at period close. You will process requests for transfer / retirement / disposal of fixed assets, and support documentation of asset inventory checks. You will execute the monthly depreciation run and necessary entries. You will also complete all month end activities, including reconciliations and reporting as required. You will support the company goals by focusing on personal accountability, customer service and work efficiency. Resource will also be responsible for managing delivery teams. What are we looking for? Commerce Graduate/Chartered Accountant/ICWA/CS with 6 - 7 years of experience in Fixed Assets Accounting  Candidate must possess strong written and verbal communication skills, be well organized, detail oriented, and have the ability to perform in a fast-paced changing environment Experience working with accounting applications preferred; PDI, AS400, JDE, SAP, Recon Net, Blackline, Service-now Fair understanding and experience of executing / leading process transformation actions Bachelor's / Master degree in accounting  6+ years of accounting experience in Fixed Assets Must be computer literate in MS Excel and Access. Ability to organize and prioritize detailed information. Strong written and verbal communication skills required to effectively work with other departments. Experience working with ERP applications is a plus.  Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role, you are required to fulfil below responsibilities: -  Record fixed asset acquisitions and dispositions in the Fixed Asset System (FAS) Track the compilation of projects costs in Purchase Order/Project Accounting (POPA) system into the FAS system when projects have been completed Prepare project entries as needed to ensure correct recording of invoices. Assist with the set-up of assets. Reconcile the account balances in FAS subsidiary ledger to the Property, Plant, and Equipment (PP&E) General Ledger accounts Complete depreciation and economic penalty analysis on asset additions Run depreciation calculation in FAS for all fixed assets and prepare journal entries Support Tax Department with fixed asset data requests. Responsible for ensuring store asset audits are performed every 5 years. Prepares financial reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing account information and trends. Documents financial transactions by entering account information, while substantiating these transactions by auditing documents when needed Ensures compliance with requirements, policies and regulations by enforcing adherence to corporate controls and policies. Maintains financial security by ensuring that internal controls and SOX controls are being followed Adhere to Company and department policies and procedures Promptly and effectively communicating with both internal and external stakeholders Assisting Record to Report Manager in any other RTR/FA related tasks and projects Ability to comprehend basic statistics and terms involved in the day-to-day business and using the same during process discussions. Identification of process improvement / lean ideas to avoid measurable, repeatable, predictable and transaction processing efforts Constantly be on the lookout for ways to enhance value for your respective stakeholders/clients Ensure that the SLAs and Operations metrics are met Guide, support, and work with other team leaders & team members  Prepare management reports for clients and internal management Share feedbacks and execute performance management actions Execution of backup planning for all service delivery actions Facilitate quality checks for the work performed by the team members Participation in performance review/governance discussions with client Managing small / mid size teams (5-15 FTE) Qualification Any Graduation
column11: fixed assets, sap, jde, accounting, fixed asset accounting, erp, accounts payable, journal entries, customer service, as400, general accounting, process improvement, jd edwards, general ledger, rtr, underwriting, pdi, performance management, finance

column2: What you??l do:       ?????Eaton?? GFSS, Pune is currently seeking a FP&A Analyst for Vehicle North America division. This position is based out of Pune, India. The financial analyst is responsible for supporting the Vehicle Group, North America in preparing timely and effective analyses for financial reporting. This role will be responsible to provide actionable insights to ensure a solid decision-making process. column2: A career in our Advisory Acceleration Centre is the natural extension of PwC s leading class global delivery capabilities     We provide premium, cost effective, high quality services that support process quality and delivery capability in support for client engagements             Position Requirements:       Key Responsibilities:         As a team member, you ll work as part of a team of problem solvers with extensive consulting and industry experience, helping our clients solve their complex business issues from strategy to execution         Specific areas of focus include but are not limited to:       Finance Strategy Vision: Assist the finance function to define the finance vision, outline clear-set of value proposition, define sustainable cost reduction model, prepare a roadmap for finance transformation strategy, define and develop a finance target operating model     Shared Services: Define finance service delivery model, perform feasibility study including location assessment, conduct FTE/volume analysis, activity process split, develop business case to support   implementation and program manage transitions     Business Process Re-engineering: by streamlining / standardizing the processes to enable cost effective operations     Performance / KPI Management - define an effective set of performance measures and KPIs which will focus the business on the delivery of strategy and business plans     Deals related services: Post-merger integration and transaction support, assist with acquisition support /Day-1 readiness for finance accounting functions     Financial Planning Analysis: Assess the existing planning function, develop the vision for the end-state planning cycle with a clearly articulated process and system improvement roadmap including key milestones, expected benefits and impact of technology   Close Reporting: Optimize financial close process, design future-ready and regulatory compliant reporting models, design models for cash flow reporting     Working Capital Optimization: Analyze and define strategies for cash management, define cash management process, enable transactional process efficiency to optimize cash flow and liquidity, evaluate   investment alternatives and make recommendations, drive the development of cash forecast     Digital in Finance: Digital in finance including automation assessments, robotics process automation,     Finance Workforce of the future etc Design and implement digital finance platforms and provide functional expertise in implementations that enable higher efficiency, effectiveness and productivity among   leadership             Knowledge required:         An ideal candidate for the Finance Transformation practice of PwC Advisory Acceleration Center should be proficient in one or more of the below:     Demonstrate working knowledge in any of the areas of finance, management accounting, reporting, shared services and / or knowledge in any sector     Have strong business acumen, with an ability to understand how business processes and decisions impact people and organization     Ability to conduct walkthroughs, workshops and meetings involving various business stakeholders     Good to have exposure to one of technology being ERPs / financial systems such as Oracle, SAP, Workday, etc     Proficient in Microsoft Office suite of products such as PowerPoint, Visio, Excel, Word etc     Working knowledge of any Digital Tools and accelerators such Alteryx, PowerBI, Tableau, UiPath etc would be an added advantage                 Desired Skills:         Strong analytical and numerical skills, and domain knowledge     Effective storytelling and communication skills to various audiences (written and verbal)     Strong work ethic, proactive and professional behavior     Strategic and creative thinker, problem solver     Supports engagement manager in delivering engagements by identifying and column2: We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Semi-Qualified CA/ MBA/Bcom to join      our Finance team as an FP&A Analyst. The successful candidate will be responsible for      assisting in managing monthly Management Information Systems (MIS), Key Performance      Indicators (KPIs), and cost tracking processes.          This role requires strong analytical skills,      attention to detail, and the ability to communicate effectively with various stakeholders.        Responsibilities:          Assist in the preparation and analysis of monthly MIS reports, including but not limited to income statements.      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather relevant financial data and ensure accuracy and completeness of information.      Support in the development and maintenance of KPI dashboards to monitor business performance and identify areas for improvement.      Prepare variance analysis reports to highlight discrepancies between actual performance and budgeted/forecasted figures.      Assist in the development of annual budgets and periodic forecasts, working closely with department heads to gather input and validate assumptions.      Maintain and update cost tracking tools and databases to ensure accurate and timely reporting of expenses.      Conduct ad-hoc financial analysis and provide insights to support decision-making processes.      Assist in the implementation of process improvements to enhance efficiency and effectiveness of financial reporting and analysis activities.            Qualifications:        Semi-qualified Chartered Accountant (CA)/MBA /Bcom with a strong academic background in FP&A, reporting, finance, or related field.      2-3 years of relevant experience in financial planning and analysis, management reporting, or similar roles.      Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other financial modeling tools; experience with ERP systems (SAP) is a plus.      Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret financial data and trends effectively.      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across functions and levels of the organization.      Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and data integrity.      Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.      Proactive mindset with a willingness to take initiative and drive process improvements.      Knowledge of accounting principles and financial regulations.

column2: We are seeking skilled and motivated Finance and Accounting Professionals to join our team. The successful candidates will play key roles in managing financial operations, analyzing financial data, and providing strategic insights to support business decision-making. These roles offer the opportunity to work on diverse and challenging projects, collaborating with a team of experts to ensure financial stability and growth.                Key Responsibilities:              Managing day-to-day financial operations, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger maintenance.          Preparing and analyzing financial statements, reports, and forecasts to provide insights into business performance and financial health.          Conducting financial analysis, variance analysis, and cost-benefit analysis to support strategic decision-making and resource allocation.          Monitoring cash flow, budgeting, and forecasting to ensure optimal financial management and liquidity.          Developing and implementing financial controls, policies, and procedures to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards.          Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing, and operations, to provide financial guidance and support for business initiatives.          Providing financial insights and recommendations to senior management to inform business strategy and planning.              Qualifications:              Bachelor s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field; Master s degree or CPA/CMA certification preferred.          Proven experience in finance and accounting roles, with a strong understanding of financial principles, practices, and regulations.          Proficiency in financial analysis, financial modeling, and financial reporting.          Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret financial data and trends.          Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities effectively.          Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.          Experience with financial software and systems, such as ERP systems, Excel, and financial modeling tools.          Experience working in the technology industry or related fields is a plus.          Experience working on multidisciplinary projects and interfacing with clients is a plus.

column2: Skill required:  Record To Report - Account Reconciliations Designation:  Record to Report Ops Senior Analyst Qualifications: BCom  Years of Experience: 5 to 8 years  What would you do? Work closely with the business unit of the customer organisation and provide them with financial accounting support in particular on period-end close of the General Ledger so as to be able to report financial results in a timely and accurate manner and also to support in exercising financial control over the General Ledger mainly through the process of account reconciliations. Also requires ability to prepare and present financial information through reports. Posting journal entries, preparing balance sheet reconciliations, reviewing entries and reconciliations, preparing cash forecasting statement, supporting month end closing, preparing reports and supports in audits.A type of general ledger account which contains a summary of sub-ledger accounts. Because the reconciliation account only provides a summary, no transactions are directly posted to the account. What are we looking for?  General Accounting ERP System (Eg. SAP)Account Reconciliations MS OfficeAuditProactive / InitiativeAnalytical abilityTeam playerCommunication SkillsRelationship ManagementWorking Conditions In general, willing to work across different shift hours including USA work hours Interact with clients good verbal and written communication. Build and maintain relationships in a multicultural context.  Capable of working independently with minimal supervision Ability to meet tight deadlines with focus on quality, results and timely delivery. Candidate will need to stretch during peak / critical service delivery periods and may require to work for long work hours  Roles and Responsibilities:  "Responsibilities/Authorities Responsible for financial accounting and reporting that has a material impact on key components of the client's financial statements. Responsible for the preparation, coordination and review of financial accounting analyses and journal entries to properly recognize actual results for material components of the client's operations. May be required to prepare a wide range of financial reporting applicable to scope of the assigned responsibilities. Demonstrates analytical and problem solving skills Coordinates and contributes to accounting processes. Proactively recognizes problems within scope of responsibilities, draws from appropriate resources to identify options and solutions based on the relative cost benefit, then implements solutions. Proactively adapts to a changing business environment and revises accounting processes and procedures accordingly. Maintains an awareness of the client's business, operational activities, and processes in areas pertaining to scope of responsibilities. Must have a high user proficiency in the client's financial systems and desktop applications. Maintains strong technical accounting skills, and accounting systems and process skills. Prepares and ensures accuracy of accounting data. Ensures account analyses are comprehensive, substantive, and performed on a timely basis. Ensures that assigned monthly, quarterly, and year-end reporting targets are met. May be called to participate in the development and installation of system enhancements when required. Reviews financial accounting and regulatory requirements as well as client accounting policies and procedures, and ensures compliance. Requires good knowledge of multiple systems and data flows.
